definition: prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee

sentences.english: I suddenly remembered the two resident engineers' great trust.
sentences.chinese: 突然间想起了两位驻地工程师的重托。

sentences.english: We must bear in mind the trust of the party and the people, and resolutely to complete their tasks.
sentences.chinese: 我们一定要牢记党和人民的重托，坚决完成任务。

sentences.english: He is holding the property in great trust for her.
sentences.chinese: 他受重托为她保管这财产。

sentences.english: With all these fine characters, Lawyer Xu will never let his clients down.
sentences.chinese: 徐新明律师当不辜负委托人的信赖与重托。

sentences.english: I hesitate to ask you, but will you recommend me for the post?
sentences.chinese: 向你重托真不好意思，请你推荐我去担任那职务好吗？

sentences.english: The weight of expectation could drag Spain down.
sentences.chinese: 期待的重托也在给西班牙增加负担，欲将其拉垮。

sentences.english: I think you ought to superimpose the great trust of mine on your heart.
sentences.chinese: 我想你应该牢记住我对你的重托。

definition: to entrust a task to sb else
to shoulder (a burden)/to bear/to suffer (a disadvantage)
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to be duty bound/to be one's unshirkable responsibility
to be ashamed to face (sb)/to feel bad about having failed (sb)
the mission in life of a deceased person, left to others to carry on
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
